requestBody.description:
# recording.completed

This event is triggered when a recording of a meeting or webinar becomes available to view or download.

Users with a Pro or a higher plan have access to [cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording). Account owners and account admins can [enable cloud recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_29fc1846-190d-4f05-ab23-1070c8106ec8) for account members.
Users can also enable cloud recordings [for their own use](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_4cca2458-cbd5-4439-933c-57c0d62a2753).

Only meeting or webinar hosts and co-hosts can start and complete a [cloud recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording). A recording is considered complete **after** the host or co-host ends the meeting or webinar.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* Enable Cloud recording on the users' account.
* Enable **Event Subscriptions** for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with:
	* A valid **Event notification endpoint URL**.
	* The **All Recordings have completed** subscription must be enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.completed`

event_ts.description: A timestamp when the event occurred.

download_token.description:
Use the generated token value with the download_url value to download the cloud recording via an [OAuth app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-oauth-app). The download token only lasts for 24 hours after its creation, and you can only download the file within 24 hours of receiving the event notification. Pass download_token as a bearer token in the authorization header of your HTTP request. 

 
curl --request GET \
  --url {download_url} \
  --header 'authorization: Bearer {download_token} \
  --header 'content-type: application/json'
.

payload|account_id.description: The account ID of the user who completed the meeting or webinar recording.

payload|object.description: Information about the meeting or webinar recording.

id.description: The ID of the recorded meeting (meetingId) or webinar (webinarId).

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier (UUID) of the recorded meeting or webinar instance.

host_id.description: The ID of the user set as the host of the meeting or webinar.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who completed the meeting or webinar recording.

type.description:
The type of recorded meeting or webinar. 

 If the recording is of a meeting: 
* 1 — Instant meeting. 
* 2 — Scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A meeting created via PMI (Personal Meeting ID). 
* 7 — A [Personal Audio Conference](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference) (PAC). 
* 8 - Recurring meeting with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is of a webinar: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is **not** from a meeting or webinar: 

* 99 — A recording uploaded via the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) interface on the Zoom Web Portal.

start_time.description: The meeting's or webinar's start time.

share_url.description: The URL where approved users can view the recording.

total_size.description: The recording file's total size, in bytes.

recording_count.description: The number of completed recording files.

on_prem.description: Whether the recording is an [on-premise](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034064852-Zoom-On-Premise-Deployment) recording.

recording_play_passcode.description: The cloud recording's password to be used in the URL. This recording's password can be directly spliced in play_url or share_url with ?pwd= to access and play, such as in 'https://zoom.us/rec/share/**************?pwd=yNYIS408EJygs7rE5vVsJwXIz4-VW7MH'. See [Embedding meeting passcode in invite link](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060396571-Embedding-meeting-passcode-in-invite-link) for details. If you want to use this field, please contact Zoom support.

recording_files.description: Information about the completed recording files.

recording_start.description: The date and time when recording started.

recording_end.description: The date and time when recording ended.

file_type.description: The type of the recording file.

file_size.description: The recording file's size, in bytes.

file_extension.description: The file extension type of the recording file.

play_url.description: The URL where the recording file can be opened and played.

download_url.description:
The URL to download the the recording. To download the recording file of a meeting or a webinar, use the download_token value to download the file. For example: 

 https://{{base-domain}}/rec/webhook_download/download/xxx--header 'Authorization: Bearer {{your-download_token-value}}

file_path.description:
The file path to the on-premise account recording. 

 **Note:** This API returns this field for [Zoom On-Premise accounts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034064852-Zoom-On-Premise-Deployment). It does **not** return the download_url field.

status.description:
The recording file's processing status. 
* completed — The processing of the file is complete. 
* processing — The file is processing.

recording_type.description:
The recording file type. 
* shared_screen_with_speaker_view(CC) 
* shared_screen_with_speaker_view 
* shared_screen_with_gallery_view 
* gallery_view 
* shared_screen 
* audio_only 
* audio_transcript 
* chat_file 
* active_speaker 
* host_video 
* audio_only_each_participant 
* cc_transcript 
* closed_caption 
* poll 
* timeline 
* thumbnail 
* audio_interpretation 
* summary 
* summary_next_steps 
* summary_smart_chapters 
*sign_interpretation 

For more information, read our [Managing and sharing cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205347605-Managing-and-sharing-cloud-recordings#h_9898497b-e736-4980-a749-d55608f10773) documentation.

participant_audio_files.description: Information about the participants' audio files.

recording_start.description: The participant audio file's start time.

recording_end.description: The participant audio file's end time.

file_size.description: The participant audio file's size, in bytes.

play_url.description: The URL to open and play the participant audio file.

download_url.description:
The URL to download the the recording. To download the recording file of a meeting or a webinar, use the download_token value to download the file. For example: 

 https://{{base-domain}}/rec/webhook_download/download/xxx--header 'Authorization: Bearer {{your-download_token-value}}

file_path.description:
The file path to the on-premise account recording. 

 **Note:** This API returns this field for [Zoom On-Premise accounts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034064852-Zoom-On-Premise-Deployment). It does **not** return the download_url field.

status.description:
The participant audio file's processing status. 
* completed — The processing of the file is complete. 
* processing — The file is processing.

# recording.started

The **Recording Started** event is triggered every time a recording is started by one of your app users or account users.

All users with a Pro or a higher plan have access to [cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording). An account owner or account admin can [enable cloud recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_29fc1846-190d-4f05-ab23-1070c8106ec8) for all account members as well as for members that belong to a certain group. Users can also enable cloud recordings [for their own use](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_4cca2458-cbd5-4439-933c-57c0d62a2753).

Only a host or a co-host of the meeting/webinar can [start cloud recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_7420acb5-1897-4061-87b4-5b76e99c03b4) of the meeting/webinar.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* Cloud recording must be enabled on the users' account.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Recording Started** subscription must be enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.started`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

payload|account_id.description: The account ID of the user that started the meeting or webinar recording.

payload|object.description: Information about the meeting or webinar recording.

id.description: The ID of the recorded meeting (meetingId) or webinar (webinarId).

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier (UUID) of the recorded meeting or webinar instance.

host_id.description: The ID of the user set as the host of the meeting or webinar.

type.description:
The type of recorded meeting or webinar: 

 If the recording is of a meeting: 
* 1 — Instant meeting. 
* 2 — Scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A meeting created via PMI (Personal Meeting ID). 
* 7 — A [Personal Audio Conference](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference) (PAC). 
* 8 - Recurring meeting with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is of a webinar: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is **not** from a meeting or webinar: 

* 99 — A recording uploaded via the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) interface on the Zoom Web Portal.

start_time.description: The meeting or webinar's start time.

duration.description: The meeting or webinar's scheduled duration.

recording_start.description: The date and time at which the recording started.

recording_end.description: The date and time at which the recording ended.

# recording.stopped

The **Recording Stopped** event is triggered every time a recording is stopped by one of your app's users or account users.

All users with a Pro or a higher plan have access to [cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording). An account owner or account admin can [enable cloud recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_29fc1846-190d-4f05-ab23-1070c8106ec8) for all account members as well as for members that belong to a certain group. Users can also enable cloud recordings [for their own use](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_4cca2458-cbd5-4439-933c-57c0d62a2753).

Only a host or a co-host of the meeting/webinar can start, pause, resume, or stop a [cloud recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording).

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* Cloud recording must be enabled on the users' account.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Recording Stopped** subscription must be enabled under the **Recording** event.

 If the recording is of a meeting:

* 2 — Scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A meeting created via PMI (Personal Meeting ID). 
* 7 — A [Personal Audio Conference](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference) (PAC). 
* 8 - Recurring meeting with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is of a webinar:

 If the recording is **not** from a meeting or webinar: 

* 99 — A recording uploaded via the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) interface on the Zoom Web Portal.

start_time.description: The meeting or webinar's start time.

duration.description: The meeting or webinar's scheduled duration.

recording_start.description: The date and time at which the recording started.

recording_end.description: The date and time at which the recording ended.
